column4: I could use a hand installing ndiswrapper, anyone got a spare minute? /t me
dont really have a choice since I only have win drivers for my belkin USB wifi card.
I got the drivers, and I downloaded ndiswrapper, but when I install it it says:
Error: Dependency is not satisfiable: ndiswrapper modules 1.1
aparently I got the wrong version of ndiswrapper downloaded?
: sudo apt-get install ndiswrapper-source
: yes
no real help then since it's my internet conn Im trying to get to work :)
: ok
: configure, make and sudo make install
uhm, huh?
: in aterminal go to the extracted files, then type first ./configure, then make then sudo make install
: cd /home/username/Desktop/Nidiswrapper-xx
Im there
: sorry, i just see you don't have to do configure, just begin with make
ah that would explain it. lets try that then
: I think you need to install it first, but without connection it will be difficult ;)
: You need some other package to build ndiswrapper
: watch on http://packages.ubuntulinux.org/ all the packages you need for ndiswrapper
: then do it by hand is a lot of work
: ok, but try to get a cable internet connection, it will be eays then
